metadata.title: CASE 570/03: Report of Investigation
metadata.primary_source: United Nations Office of Internal Oversight Services

overview: This report details the findings from Case No. 0570/03, conducted by the Investigations Division of the UN OIOS, regarding inappropriate information sharing and allegations of misconduct at ECA. Specific details are redacted for confidentiality.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Staff members shall exercise the utmost discretion with regard to all matters of official business. They shall not communicate to any Government, entity, person or any other source any information known to them by reason of their official position that they know or ought to have known has not been made public, except as appropriate in the normal course of their duties or by authorization of the Secretary-General. These obligations do not cease upon separation from service.

methodology.description: The investigation involved collecting and analyzing relevant documents and interviews with key staff members.
interviews: Re-interview with the female staff member
documents_reviewed: Emails sent to Ambassador Negroponte and US Government officials

background.context: Investigation centered on emails containing allegations of misconduct by ECA staff, including inappropriate communication with external parties.
timeline: 2003-11: Staff member retired after serving 25 years

investigation_details.subject: Staff member at the Economic Commission for Africa

allegations.findings: Anonymous email sent on 2003-01-26 alleged misconduct within ECA, directed to US officials.

allegations.description: Emails to Ambassador Negroponte and US Officials
allegations.findings: Staff member sent emails contrary to UN policies.
Staff member initially denied, then admitted to sending emails as a staff representative.

allegations.description: Emails to Mr. Mzumara, OIC, SRO, Lusaka
allegations.findings: Staff member confirmed correspondence about communications with US officials.
Mr. Mzumara confirmed the communication regarding grievances.
Email detailed claims of harassment and inaction, insufficient evidence found.

allegations.description: Allegation of Sexual Harassment during 2001 office retreat
allegations.findings: Alleged incident by a manager, witnesses denied knowledge, insufficient evidence.

allegations.description: Circular to raise awareness about sexual harassment
allegations.findings: Circular issued, but no incidents reported.

allegations.description: Denied allegations by Mr. Ali Todaro
allegations.findings: Mr. Todaro denied accusations; unable to pursue due to lack of complainant identification.

findings: Insufficient evidence supports allegations of sexual harassment.
Contradictory testimonies were presented by parties involved.
The female staff member did not pursue the complaint via UN systems after employment.

actions: Place the investigation report in the staff member’s Personnel Status File. ID Rec. No. IV03/570/01.
Office of Legal Affairs (OLA) should issue a cease and desist letter to the staff member, emphasizing the obligation against unauthorized information dissemination. ID Rec. No. IV03/570/02.
